Next, we must implement policies that encourage the natural growth of our community while discouraging the influence of outsiders. This includes economic incentives for families who uphold traditional values, and the gradual phasing out of institutions that promote division. We must take control of our media, our art, and our public discourse, ensuring that only messages that reinforce our unity and strength are allowed to spread.

At the same time, we must not be naive. There are those among us who do not belong, whose presence is not only harmful but parasitic. These individuals must be identified, and their influence neutralized. This may require difficult measures, but it is for the greater good. We must not be swayed by sentimentality or the false morality of the weak. Our future depends on the courage to act decisively.

Finally, we must build a new social order, one that rewards loyalty and punishes disloyalty. Those who embrace our vision will thrive, while those who resist will be left behind. This is not cruelty—it is necessity. Only through this process can we achieve the true harmony of a society that is strong, unified, and free from the corruption of external influences.
